title: return to older version
content:
I have Thunderbird in 3 computers. I downloaded the upgrade this week and a lot of changes took place. Then I got locked out? All kinds of colors turned themselves on, then it kept asking me if I wanted to change a function???? I kept saying no, then yes. It continued to ask. Turned off the computer and worried if I get my old stuff back. Today it is working but incoming mail is in the lower part of the screen, old mail is in the top. How do I go back to the old version. This is my desktop

I just turned on my laptop and it asked me to upgrade. NOPE! I've used you guys for years and only made a small donation, sorry. Didn't know you have an app for my Android??? Would have tried it. Does your browser follow and track me like Chrome, which I hate. I will aways speak well of you guys even if I can't go back to the older version. See ya, Randy
creator: Randyjohnjett

title: Side by side error
content: Hello. I am using Win11 and have been a Mozilla Thunderbird user for many years. Today I cannot open Thunderbird due to a "side-by-side" error. See image attached. I am not very computer savvy and therefor find some of the suggested solutions on the web rather difficult to understand and apply. I would appreciate any help you can be. Thanks, Murray Kerr, Auckland, NZ.
creator: MurrayKerr

title: Deleted mails
content: I use Thunderbird with IMAP configuration. In the last days, after deleting emails from the Inbox, they keep reappearing. I’ve tried deleting the "Deleted Items.msf" file in the imapMail folder, but it hasn’t solved the problem.
creator: rllata

title: Sending automatic reply "out of office"
content: Hi, I have a problem, when i set outomatic reply on my account email has send, but with wrong encoding. I 'm writting mail in czech language, so you probably wont be understanding. In the picture is a screen of mail, that was automatic sent, please help me, what i should to change in settings.
creator: simon9durak

title: Cannot access Thunderbird
content:
Hi. I successfully used Thunderbird a few years ago BUT went to Mailbird BAD MOVE.

I INSTALLED the software again fine but on running it needs a password which I haven’t got if it’s the password to my email hosting company IONOS Thunderbird tells me they have a problem with IONOS so I’m VERY stuck.

HELP. ! Thank you. PD.
creator: peter858

title: How to remove menu items ?
content:
Hi. Same question as in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1226211 : How can I customize the TB's main menu ?

I would like to remove menu items, which I never use:

  • for simplicity
  • to avoid accidental deletion (e.g. "delete folder", "delete message", "delete mail marked as junk in folder", etc.)

many thanks!
creator: welcome
